data.Name: Cori DiBiase
data.staff_bio: After earning a bachelor's degree in philosophy from Purchase College, Cori worked in a variety of fields including marketing for a fledgling IT firm, teaching in the public schools, and selling vacuum cleaners door to door. Prior to joining the National Center on Workforce and Disability/Adult, he directed a statewide agency providing employment and entrepreneurial assistance to people with disabilities. In this role, he worked with unique service delivery models, building partnerships with a variety of state agencies, not-for-profit organizations, and businesses. Cori currently provides technical assistance on a national level to the workforce development system on various issues including employment, entrepreneurship, and policy.
